title: Downtown Stamford apartment complex sold for $60M
title_page: Downtown Stamford apartment complex sold for $60M
maintext:
STAMFORD — The downtown Stamford Corners apartment complex, at 1455 Washington Blvd., has sold for $60 million in the city’s largest property sale so far this year.
Los Angeles-based 1455 Washington Boulevard LLC sold the building to Deer Park, N.Y.-based Stamcon Holdings LLC, according to city property records.
The business address for 1455 Washington Boulevard LLC is the same as Los Angeles-based real estate investment firm CIM. Other CIM assets include 432 Park Avenue, the 1,396-foot-tall condominium tower in midtown Manhattan.
A message left for CIM was not returned.
The sale price is almost identical to the property’s appraisal value listed in the online real estate database, Vision Appraisal. The approximately 200-unit 1455 Washington was built in 1999, and also sold for about $60 million in a 2006 transaction.
Apartments are available at 1455 Washington at monthly rents between about $2,150 and $3,100, according to realtor.com.
The sale netted the state $450,000 in conveyance taxes.
Among other recent sales, a future self-storage facility at 370 W. Main St. sold for $5.5 million.
At the turn of the year, the downtown office complex at 600 Summer St. changed hands for about $18 million.
Other sales in the past few months have included the site of the Stamford Marriott hotel, which sold last October for about $32 million, and a two-building complex at 1111-1117 Summer St., which was bought last October for around $12 million.
